vague_description: Determine the optimal mix of full-time and part-time staff needed to meet mail delivery hours, while staying under budget.
detailed_description: A municipality hires full-time and part-time staff to deliver mail. Part-time staff works \param{PartTimeHours} hours per week and gets paid \param{PartTimePayment} dollars whereas a full-time staff works \param{FullTimeHours} hours every week and gets paid \param{FullTimePayment} dollars for that week. Since it is the week leading up to a holiday, planning ahead, the municipality needs \param{TotalLaborHours} hours of mail staff labor. The municipality has a budget of \param{TotalBudget} dollars for mail delivery for this season. How many of each type of staff should the municipality hire to decrease the total number of staff?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of full-time and part-time staff hired
target_constraints: Number of full-time staff is non-negative
Number of part-time staff is non-negative
Total hours worked by part-time and full-time staff equals TotalLaborHours
Total payment to part-time and full-time staff is at most TotalBudget
target_parameters: Number of hours worked by a part-time staff member per week
Payment to a part-time staff member per week
Number of hours worked by a full-time staff member per week
Payment to a full-time staff member per week
Total number of hours of labor needed by the municipality for the week
Total budget available for mail delivery for the season
